intro: Conopodium flexuosum, commonly known as the flexible bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibacillaceae. It is characterized by its floating leaves and specialized bladder-like structures used for capturing small aquatic organisms. The plant typically grows in shallow, still or slow-moving freshwater habitats. Its roots are often anchored in muddy or sandy substrates, and it can form dense mats on the water surface. Conopodium flexuosum plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to nutrient cycling.
